name: Muslim Association of Puget Sound
mission: PNW Seminary provides a structured program for adults to deepen their understanding of Islamic scholarship and leadership.
zakatClaimEvidence: Zakat (Almsgiving). Fulfill your religious obligation of almsgiving (Zakat) to purify your wealth. Zakat funds will be distributed by MAPS to those in need, in adherence to Islamic guidelines. Give Your Zakat Now! (Source: https://mapsredmond.org/donate)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Muslim Association of Puget Sound shows strong alignment and limited impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Zakat (Almsgiving). Fulfill your religious obligation of almsgiving (Zakat) to purify your wealth. Zakat funds will be distributed by MAPS to those in need, in adherence to Islamic guidelines. Give Your Zakat Now! (Source: https://mapsredmond.org/donate)

all_citations.claim: The organization reported total revenue of $7,286,362 and operates the PNW Seminary for Islamic scholarship.
The organization provides options for zakat-eligible donations and supports daily prayers.
Financial metrics include a program expense ratio of 81.7%, fundraising efficiency of $0.02 per $1 raised, and 17.3 months of working capital.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization demonstrates strong financial health and efficient fundraising, though its overall score is moderated by a lower impact rating due to the high cost per beneficiary and limited external data confidence.
areas_for_improvement: Relatively high cost per beneficiary calculated at approximately $778.64
Limited third-party impact verification resulting in a lower directness score

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 38/50, the charity shows high donor fit for those seeking to support religious and cultural causes [3]. Its zakat-eligible status and focus on Islamic leadership through the PNW Seminary align closely with the needs of the Muslim community [2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization allocates 81.7% of its $7,286,362 total revenue directly to its programs [1]. While it holds 17.3 months of working capital, the impact score of 15/50 reflects a high cost per beneficiary of $778.64 and a need for more transparent evidence of program effectiveness [3].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Muslim Association of Puget Sound serves as a vital hub for Islamic scholarship, leadership development, and spiritual practice in the Pacific Northwest.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 81.7%, indicating a strong commitment to direct service delivery
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.02 per $1 raised
Robust liquidity with 17.3 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: The Muslim Association of Puget Sound (MAPS) operates the PNW Seminary, a structured program designed to deepen adult understanding of Islamic scholarship and leadership [1]. The organization facilitates daily prayers and comprehensive educational programs while maintaining a status as a zakat-eligible entity for donors [2].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization demonstrates strong financial health and efficient fundraising, though its overall score is moderated by a lower impact rating due to the high cost per beneficiary and limited external data confidence.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization currently lacks a <cite id="1">documented theory of change</cite> and has <cite id="1">unverified evidence of outcomes</cite>, which limits the ability to assess long-term efficacy.
The calculated <cite id="1">cost per beneficiary is $778.64</cite>, which is relatively high compared to broader humanitarian benchmarks.

bbb_assessment.summary: This organization is not currently evaluated by the BBB Wise Giving Alliance.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization's long-standing presence and high program ratio suggest resources are reaching the community, even if not formally measured.
case_against.summary: The primary concerns involve <cite id="1">limited transparency regarding impact metrics</cite> and a lack of a formal <cite id="1">theory of change</cite>.

confidence.notes: Financial metrics are strong, but impact data is missing.

alignment.explanation: Alignment is high (38/50) due to its <cite id="2">verified zakat-eligible status</cite> and focus on <cite id="1">Islamic scholarship and community service</cite>.

credibility.explanation: Donors can find confidence in the organization's <cite id="3">100% independent board</cite> and its <cite id="1">20-year track record</cite> of service in the region. However, credibility is tempered by <cite id="1">weak board governance documentation</cite> in public filings.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the organization should <cite id="1">publish a clear reserve-use policy</cite> and formalize its board member disclosures.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by a <cite id="3">81.7% program ratio</cite> and a direct provision model. However, the <cite id="1">impact score of 15/50</cite> is limited by the absence of <cite id="1">third-party evaluations</cite>.
impact.improvement: The organization should <cite id="1">seek external evaluation</cite> or track specific outcomes over a 3-year period to validate its educational success.

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct service provision rather than grantmaking

rich_narrative.headline: The Muslim Association of Puget Sound serves as a vital hub for Islamic scholarship, leadership development, and spiritual practice in the Pacific Northwest.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value local Islamic institutional growth and want to support a high-efficiency community hub in the Pacific Northwest.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat through a local community mosque and seminary
Value high financial efficiency and low fundraising overhead
Prioritize the preservation of Islamic scholarship in America
giving_considerations: Donations support a broad range of services from prayers to advocacy
The organization has a strong local footprint but limited global reach
Evidence of impact is primarily anecdotal rather than data-driven
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking rigorous, data-backed humanitarian outcomes or those looking for international emergency relief.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects that while programs are active, there is <cite id="1">no formal tracking of long-term educational or social outcomes</cite>.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: MAPS creates impact by providing religious education and spiritual spaces, assuming these lead to better-informed and more engaged Muslim citizens.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that religious education programs are effectively meeting the spiritual and intellectual needs of the community.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="1">revenue growth of 20.8%</cite> and expanding programs like the PNW Seminary, the organization has a high capacity to absorb new funding for infrastructure.

strengths.detail: MAPS directs <cite id="3">81.7% of its total expenses</cite> toward its core programs, exceeding the <cite id="1">industry standard of 75%</cite> for religious and cultural organizations.
The organization spends just <cite id="3">$0.01 to raise every dollar</cite> in contributions, maximizing the impact of every donation.
The charity maintains <cite id="3">17.3 months of working capital</cite>, providing a significant safety net for long-term operational stability.

strengths_deep_dive: The Muslim Association of Puget Sound exhibits strong financial health and growth, with <cite id="1">revenue increasing at a 20.8% compound annual growth rate</cite> over the last three years. This growth is managed with high accountability, as the organization maintains an <cite id="3">independent board of directors at 100%</cite>. Their commitment to direct service is reflected in their <cite id="1">direct provision delivery model</cite>, which focuses on immediate community needs such as <cite id="1">daily prayers and educational seminars</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: The Muslim Association of Puget Sound (MAPS) serves as a cornerstone for the Muslim community in the Pacific Northwest, providing a multifaceted platform for <cite id="1">spiritual practice, leadership development, and Islamic scholarship</cite>. Central to its mission is the PNW Seminary, which offers <cite id="1">structured educational programs for adults</cite> to deepen their theological understanding. Beyond its role as a place of worship, MAPS facilitates <cite id="1">daily prayers, interfaith advocacy, and community service</cite> initiatives that integrate faith with civic engagement. Financially, the organization demonstrates a high level of operational efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 81.7%</cite>, which ensures that the vast majority of donor contributions directly support its religious and educational services. This efficiency is further highlighted by its <cite id="3">fundraising cost of only $0.02 per $1 raised</cite>, a metric significantly better than many industry peers. The organization has shown strong financial growth, evidenced by a <cite id="1">3-year revenue CAGR of 20.8%</cite>, reflecting increasing community trust and support. As a <cite id="2">zakat-eligible entity</cite>, MAPS provides a vital channel for local donors to fulfill their religious obligations through programs that serve the <cite id="1">poor, needy, and wayfarers</cite>.
